Viber

Seamless Communication, Anytime, Anywhere

DATE

June 2022 - Jan 2023

CLIENT NAME

VIBER

SERVICES

Brand Identity

Web Design

App Design

My role as a product designer centred on enhancing the Viber website & app across multiple platforms, including Android & iOS, My primary objective was to elevate the Viber user experience by optimising processes and refining design journeys for end users.

Overview

Viber, a versatile voice over IP and instant messaging software, is under the ownership of the Japanese multinational corporation Rakuten. It's available as freeware on various platforms, including Google Android, iOS, Microsoft Windows, Apple macOS, and Linux.

Challenges

When I took on the role of a product designer at Viber, I encountered several noteworthy challenges that demanded immediate attention. These challenges encompassed low brand awareness, a product with substantial room for improvement, a relatively low customer acquisition rate, and an unattractive user interface. In addition to these challenges, I faced the task of creating a right-to-left interface to accommodate Arabic-speaking users.

My Approach

To address these challenges, I took a multifaceted approach. First, I focused on improving client acquisition by making the process more user-friendly and efficient. Additionally, I recognized the importance of catering to a diverse user base, so I implemented Arabic language support to both the app and the website. Finally, I tackled the issue of the unattractive interface by making it more visually appealing and user-friendly, ultimately enhancing the overall user experience.

Outcomes

Viber witnessed substantial improvements in the performance. The introduction of Arabic support opened up the app and website to a broader audience, expanding our reach and increasing brand awareness. The more user-friendly interface and streamlined client acquisition processes led to a significant boost in product usage and a higher level of customer satisfaction. Altogether, these changes contributed to a more successful and user-focused Viber platform across Google Android, iOS, Microsoft Windows, Apple macOS, and Linux, addressing the initial challenges and propelling the company forward.
